data.quote: Pain is neither unbearable nor unending, as long as you keep in mind its limits and don't magnify them in your imagination.
data.author: Marcus Aurelius

data.quote: Often a very old man has no other proof of his long life than his age.
data.author: Seneca

data.quote: It can ruin your life only if it ruins your character.
data.author: Marcus Aurelius

data.quote: Everything can be taken from a man but one thing: the last of the human freedoms- to choose one's attitude in any given set of circumstances.
data.author: Victor Frankl

data.quote: If a man knows not to which port he sails, no wind is favorable.
data.author: Seneca

data.quote: You are hurt the moment you believe yourself to be.
data.author: Epictetus

data.quote: If you are ever tempted to look for outside approval, realise that you have compromised your integrity. If you need a witness, be your own.
data.author: Epictetus

data.quote: Nothing is more hostile to a firm grasp on knowledge than self-deception.
data.author: Zeno of Citium

data.quote: Most of what we say and do is not essential. If you can eliminate it, you'll have more time and more tranquility.
data.author: Marcus Aurelius

data.quote: Circumstances don't make the man, they only reveal him to himself.
data.author: Epictetus

data.quote: You will earn the respect of all men if you begin by earning the respect of yourself.
data.author: Marcus Aurelius

data.quote: It's silly to try to escape other people's faults. They are inescapable. Just try to escape your own.
data.author: Marcus Aurelius

data.quote: That man is happiest, and is secure in his own possession of himself, who can await tomorrow without apprehension.
data.author: Seneca

data.quote: He is a wise man who does not grieve for the things which he has not, but rejoices for those which he has.
data.author: Epictetus

data.quote: Receive without pride, let go without attachment.
data.author: Marcus Aurelius

data.quote: Misfortune is virtue's opportunity.
data.author: Seneca

data.quote: Man conquers the world by conquering himself.
data.author: Zeno

data.quote: External things are not the problem. It's your assessment of them. Which you can erase right now.
data.author: Marcus Aurelius

data.quote: Leisure without study is death, a tomb for the living person.
data.author: Seneca

data.quote: It is the part of a wise man to resist pleasures, but of a foolish man to be a slave to them.
data.author: Epictetus
